oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Edward F. Jones, 2006 November 03, excerpt 09
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville business and civic leader Edward F. (Eddie) Jones, conducted on 03 November 2006 by Cabot Pyle as part of the Nashville Public Library's Nashville Business Leaders Oral History Project: The Turner Interviews. Jones discusses Mayor Beverly Briley's support of the liquor by the drink campaign and how they decided to shut down liquor sales leading up to the vote on the issue. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jones, Edward F., (Eddie), 1924- --Interviews; Briley, Beverly, 1914-1980
